context: In Estonian, 'pilk' is a noun that means a glance or look. It can refer to the act of looking at something or someone, as in taking a quick glance. The word can also be used to describe what one sees - a view or sight. In the examples provided, it's used both ways: 1) a person looking out from a window, 2) making a look/glance toward another woman, and 3) describing an apple as a beautiful sight.
